maml:description.maml:para: Gets details about a single cache or all caches in the specified resource group or all caches in the current subscription.

The Get-AzureRmRedisCache cmdlet gets the details about a cache or caches depending on input parameters. If both ResourceGroupName and Name parameters are provided then Get-AzureRmRedisCache will return details about the specific cache name provided.
If only ResourceGroupName is provided than it will return details about all caches in the specified resource group.
If no parameters are given than it will return details about all caches the current subscription.
The name of the cache. If Name is provided along with ResourceGroupName then Get-AzureRmRedisCache returns the details of the specified cache.

The name of the resource group that contains the cache or caches. If ResourceGroupName is provided with Name then Get-AzureRmRedisCache returns the details of the cache specified by Name. If only the ResourceGroup parameter is provided, then details for all caches in the resource group are returned.
The name of the cache. When this parameter is provided along with ResourceGroupName, Get-AzureRmRedisCache returns the details for the cache.

The name of the resource group that contains the cache or caches. If ResourceGroupName is provided with Name then Get-AzureRmRedisCache returns the details of the cache specified by Name. If only the ResourceGroup parameter is provided, then details for all caches in the resource group are returned.
You can pipe input to this cmdlet by property name, but not by value.
Returns an array of redis caches.

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azurerm, arm, resource, management, manager, redis, cache, web, webapp, website

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get specific redis cache by name
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\>Get-AzureRmRedisCache -ResourceGroupName myGroup -Name myexists
ResourceGroupName : myGroup Id : /subscriptions/a559b6fd-3a84-40bb-a450-b0db5ed37dfe/resourceGroups/myGroup/providers/Microsoft.Cache/Redis/myexists Location : North Central US Name : myexists Type : Microsoft.Cache/Redis HostName : myexists.redis.cache.windows.net Port : 6379 ProvisioningState : succeeded SslPort : 6380 RedisConfiguration : {} EnableNonSslPort : False RedisVersion : 2.8 Size : 1GB Sku : Basic

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets details about the specified redis cache.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Get all redis caches in a specific resource group
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\>Get-AzureRmRedisCache -ResourceGroupName myGroup
ResourceGroupName : myGroup Id : /subscriptions/a559b6fd-3a84-40bb-a450-b0db5ed37dfe/resourceGroups/myGroup/providers/Microsoft.Cache/Redis/myexists Location : North Central US Name : myexists Type : Microsoft.Cache/Redis HostName : myexists.redis.cache.windows.net Port : 6379 ProvisioningState : succeeded SslPort : 6380 RedisConfiguration : {} EnableNonSslPort : False RedisVersion : 2.8 Size : 1GB Sku : Basic
ResourceGroupName : myGroup Id : /subscriptions/a559b6fd-3a84-40bb-a450-b0db5ed37dfe/resourceGroups/myGroup/providers/Microsoft.Cache/Redis/myearlier Location : North Central US Name : myearlier Type : Microsoft.Cache/Redis HostName : myearlier.redis.cache.windows.net Port : 6379 ProvisioningState : succeeded SslPort : 6380 RedisConfiguration : {} EnableNonSslPort : True RedisVersion : 2.8 Size : 250MB Sku : Standard

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets details about all redis caches in the specified resource group.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Get all redis caches in the current subscription
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\>Get-AzureRmRedisCache
ResourceGroupName : myGroup Id : /subscriptions/a559b6fd-3a84-40bb-a450-b0db5ed37dfe/resourceGroups/myGroup/providers/Microsoft.Cache/Redis/myexists Location : North Central US Name : myexists Type : Microsoft.Cache/Redis HostName : myexists.redis.cache.windows.net Port : 6379 ProvisioningState : succeeded SslPort : 6380 RedisConfiguration : {} EnableNonSslPort : False RedisVersion : 2.8 Size : 1GB Sku : Basic
ResourceGroupName : myGroup Id : /subscriptions/a559b6fd-3a84-40bb-a450-b0db5ed37dfe/resourceGroups/myGroup/providers/Microsoft.Cache/Redis/myearlier Location : North Central US Name : myearlier Type : Microsoft.Cache/Redis HostName : myearlier.redis.cache.windows.net Port : 6379 ProvisioningState : succeeded SslPort : 6380 RedisConfiguration : {} EnableNonSslPort : True RedisVersion : 2.8 Size : 250MB Sku : Standard
ResourceGroupName : myGroup2 Id : /subscriptions/a559b6fd-3a84-40bb-a450-b0db5ed37dfe/resourceGroups/myGroup2/providers/Microsoft.Cache/Redis/myearlier2 Location : North Central US Name : myearlier2 Type : Microsoft.Cache/Redis HostName : myearlier2.redis.cache.windows.net Port : 6379 ProvisioningState : succeeded SslPort : 6380 RedisConfiguration : {} EnableNonSslPort : False RedisVersion : 2.8 Size : 250MB Sku : Basic

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets details about all redis caches in the current subscription.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new redis cache.
The New-AzureRmRedisCache cmdlet creates a new redis cache.
Name of the redis cache to create.
Name of the resource group in which to create the redis cache.

Location in which to create redis cache. Possible values are "North Central US", "South Central US", "Central US", "West Europe", "North Europe", "West US", "East US", "East US 2", "Japan East", "Japan West", "Brazil South", "Southeast Asia", "East Asia", "Australia East", "Australia Southeast"
RedisVersion is deprecated and will be removed in future release.
Size of the redis cache. The default value is 1GB or C1. Possible values are P1, P2, P3, P4, C0, C1, C2, C3, C4, C5, C6, 250MB, 1GB, 2.5GB, 6GB, 13GB, 26GB, 53GB.
Sku of redis cache. The default value is Standard. Possible values are Basic, Standard and Premium.
The 'MaxMemoryPolicy' setting has been deprecated. Please use 'RedisConfiguration' setting to set MaxMemoryPolicy. e.g. -RedisConfiguration @{"maxmemory-policy" = "allkeys-lru"}

All Redis Configuration Settings. Few possible keys: rdb-backup-enabled, rdb-storage-connection-string, rdb-backup-frequency, maxmemory-delta, maxmemory-policy, notify-keyspace-events, maxmemory-samples, slowlog-log-slower-than, slowlog-max-len, list-max-ziplist-entries, list-max-ziplist-value, hash-max-ziplist-entries, hash-max-ziplist-value, set-max-intset-entries, zset-max-ziplist-entries, zset-max-ziplist-value etc.
EnableNonSslPort is used by Azure Redis Cache. If no value is provided, the default value is false and the non-SSL port will be disabled. Possible values are true and false.
The number of shards to create on a Premium Cluster Cache.
The exact ARM resource ID of the virtual network to deploy the redis cache in. Example format: /subscriptions/{subid}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/Microsoft.ClassicNetwork/VirtualNetworks/vnet1
Required when deploying a redis cache inside an existing Azure Virtual Network.
Required when deploying a redis cache inside an existing Azure Virtual Network.
Name of the redis cache to create.
Name of resource group in which to create the redis cache.
Location in which to create the redis cache.
RedisVersion is deprecated and will be removed in future release.
Size of the redis cache. The default value is 1GB or C1. Possible values are P1, P2, P3, P4, C0, C1, C2, C3, C4, C5, C6, 250MB, 1GB, 2.5GB, 6GB, 13GB, 26GB, 53GB.
Sku of redis cache. The default value is Standard. Possible values are Basic, Standard and Premium.
The 'MaxMemoryPolicy' setting has been deprecated. Please use 'RedisConfiguration' setting to set MaxMemoryPolicy. e.g. -RedisConfiguration @{"maxmemory-policy" = "allkeys-lru"}

All Redis Configuration Settings. Few possible keys: rdb-backup-enabled, rdb-storage-connection-string, rdb-backup-frequency, maxmemory-delta, maxmemory-policy, notify-keyspace-events, maxmemory-samples, slowlog-log-slower-than, slowlog-max-len, list-max-ziplist-entries, list-max-ziplist-value, hash-max-ziplist-entries, hash-max-ziplist-value, set-max-intset-entries, zset-max-ziplist-entries, zset-max-ziplist-value etc.
EnableNonSslPort is used by Azure Redis Cache. If no value is provided, the default value is false and the non-SSL port will be disabled. Possible values are true and false.
The number of shards to create on a Premium Cluster Cache.
The exact ARM resource ID of the virtual network to deploy the redis cache in. Example format: /subscriptions/{subid}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/Microsoft.ClassicNetwork/VirtualNetworks/vnet1
Required when deploying a redis cache inside an existing Azure Virtual Network.
Required when deploying a redis cache inside an existing Azure Virtual Network.
You can pipe input to this cmdlet by property name, but not by value.
Returns all attributes of a redis cache including primary and secondary access keys.

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azurerm, arm, resource, management, manager, redis, cache, web, webapp, website

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Create new redis cache
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\>New-AzureRmRedisCache -ResourceGroupName myGroup -Name mycache -Location "North Central US"
PrimaryKey : pJ+jruGKPHDKsEC8kmoybobH3TZx2njBR3ipEsquZFo= SecondaryKey : sJ+jruGKPHDKsEC8kmoybobH3TZx2njBR3ipEsquZFo= ResourceGroupName : mygroup Id : /subscriptions/a559b6fd-3a84-40bb-a450-b0db5ed37dfe/resourceGroups/mygroup/providers/Microsoft.Cache/Redis/mycache Location : North Central US Name : mycache Type : Microsoft.Cache/Redis HostName : mycache.cache.icbbvt.windows-int.net Port : 6379 ProvisioningState : creating SslPort : 6380 RedisConfiguration : {} EnableNonSslPort : False RedisVersion : 2.8 Size : 1GB Sku : Standard

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a redis cache.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Create new redis cache with all parameters
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\>New-AzureRmRedisCache -ResourceGroupName mygroup -Name mycache -Location "North Central US" -Size 250MB -Sku Standard -RedisConfiguration @{"maxmemory-policy" = "allkeys-random"} -Force
PrimaryKey : pJ+jruGKPHDKsEC8kmoybobH3TZx2njBR3ipEsquZFo= SecondaryKey : sJ+jruGKPHDKsEC8kmoybobH3TZx2njBR3ipEsquZFo= ResourceGroupName : mygroup Id : /subscriptions/a559b6fd-3a84-40bb-a450-b0db5ed37dfe/resourceGroups/mygroup/providers/Microsoft.Cache/Redis/mycache Location : North Central US Name : mycache Type : Microsoft.Cache/Redis HostName : mycache.cache.icbbvt.windows-int.net Port : 6379 ProvisioningState : creating SslPort : 6380 RedisConfiguration : {[maxmemory-policy, allkeys-random]} EnableNonSslPort : False RedisVersion : 2.8 Size : 250MB Sku : Standard

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a redis cache or updates the redis cache if it already exists.

maml:description.maml:para: Remove redis cache if exists.
The Remove-AzureRmRedisCache cmdlet removes a redis cache if it exists.
Name of the redis cache to remove.
Name of the resource group of the cache to remove.
When the Force parameter is provided, the cache is removed without any confirmation prompts.

By default Remove-AzureRmRedisCache removes the cache and does not return any value. If the PassThru parameter is provided then Remove-AzureRmRedisCache returns a boolean value indicating the success of the operation.
Name of the redis cache to remove.
Name of the resource group of the cache to remove.
When the Force parameter is provided, the cache is removed without any confirmation prompts.

By default Remove-AzureRmRedisCache removes the cache and does not return any value. If the PassThru parameter is provided then Remove-AzureRmRedisCache returns a boolean value indicating the success of the operation.
You can pipe input to this cmdlet by property name, but not by value.
Returns true if no exception occured.

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azurerm, arm, resource, management, manager, redis, cache, web, webapp, website

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Remove a redis cache with PassThru

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes a redis cache.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Remove a redis cache without PassThru

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes a redis cache.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the accesskeys for the specified redis cache.
The Get-AzureRmRedisCacheKey cmdlet gets the access keys for the specified cache.
Name of the redis cache.
Name of the resource group for the cache.
Name of the redis cache.
Name of the resource group for the cache.
You can pipe input to this cmdlet by property name, but not by value.
Returns primary and secondary access key of redis caches.

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azurerm, arm, resource, management, manager, redis, cache, web, webapp, website

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get the access keys of a specific redis cache
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\>Get-AzureRmRedisCacheKey -ResourceGroupName myGroup -Name myexists
PrimaryKey : pJ+jruGKPHDKsEC8kmoybobH3TZx2njBR3ipEsquZFo= SecondaryKey : sJ+jruGKPHDKsEC8kmoybobH3TZx2njBR3ipEsquZFo=

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the access keys of a specific redis cache.

maml:description.maml:para: Regenerates the access key of a redis cache.
The New-AzureRmRedisCacheKey cmdlet regenerate the access key of a redis cache.
Name of the redis cache.
Name of the resource group for the cache.
Specifies whether to regenerate the primary or secondary access key. Possible values are Primary or Secondary.
When the Force parameter is provided, the specified access key is regenerated without any confirmation prompts.
Name of the redis cache.
Name of the resource group for the cache.
Specifies whether to regenerate the primary or secondary access key. Possible values are Primary or Secondary.
When the Force parameter is provided, the specified access key is regenerated without any confirmation prompts.
You can pipe input to this cmdlet by property name, but not by value.
Returns the primary and secondary access key of redis caches.

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azurerm, arm, resource, management, manager, redis, cache, web, webapp, website

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Regenerate primary key
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\>New-AzureRmRedisCacheKey -ResourceGroupName myGroup -Name mycache -KeyType Primary -Force
PrimaryKey : pJ+jruGKPHDKsEC8kmoybobH3TZx2njBR3ipEsquZFo= SecondaryKey : sJ+jruGKPHDKsEC8kmoybobH3TZx2njBR3ipEsquZFo=

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command regenerates the primary key of a redis cache.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Regenerate secondary key
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\>New-AzureRmRedisCacheKey -ResourceGroupName myGroup -Name mycache -KeyType Secondary -Force
PrimaryKey : pJ+jruGKPHDKsEC8kmoybobH3TZx2njBR3ipEsquZFo= SecondaryKey : sJ+jruGKPHDKsEC8kmoybobH3TZx2njBR3ipEsquZFo=

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command regenerates the secondary key of a redis cache.

maml:description.maml:para: Set redis cache updatable parameters.
The Set-AzureRmRedisCache cmdlet sets redis cache parameters.
Name of the redis cache to update.
Name of the resource group for the cache.
Size of the redis cache. The default value is 1GB or C1. Possible values are P1, P2, P3, P4, C0, C1, C2, C3, C4, C5, C6, 250MB, 1GB, 2.5GB, 6GB, 13GB, 26GB, 53GB.
Sku of redis cache. The default value is Standard. Possible values are Basic, Standard and Premium.
The 'MaxMemoryPolicy' setting has been deprecated. Please use 'RedisConfiguration' setting to set MaxMemoryPolicy. e.g. -RedisConfiguration @{"maxmemory-policy" = "allkeys-lru"}

All Redis Configuration Settings. Few possible keys: rdb-backup-enabled, rdb-storage-connection-string, rdb-backup-frequency, maxmemory-delta, maxmemory-policy, notify-keyspace-events, maxmemory-samples, slowlog-log-slower-than, slowlog-max-len, list-max-ziplist-entries, list-max-ziplist-value, hash-max-ziplist-entries, hash-max-ziplist-value, set-max-intset-entries, zset-max-ziplist-entries, zset-max-ziplist-value etc.
EnableNonSslPort is used by Azure Redis Cache. The default value is null and no change will be made to the currently configured value. Possible values are true and false.
The number of shards to create on a Premium Cluster Cache.
Name of the redis cache to update.
Name of the resource group for the cache.
Size of the redis cache. The default value is 1GB or C1. Possible values are P1,P2, P3, P4, C0, C1, C2, C3, C4, C5, C6, 250MB, 1GB, 2.5GB, 6GB, 13GB, 26GB, 53GB.
Sku of redis cache. The default value is Standard. Possible values are Basic, Standard and Premium.
The 'MaxMemoryPolicy' setting has been deprecated. Please use 'RedisConfiguration' setting to set MaxMemoryPolicy. e.g. -RedisConfiguration @{"maxmemory-policy" = "allkeys-lru"}

All Redis Configuration Settings. Few possible keys: rdb-backup-enabled, rdb-storage-connection-string, rdb-backup-frequency, maxmemory-delta, maxmemory-policy, notify-keyspace-events, maxmemory-samples, slowlog-log-slower-than, slowlog-max-len, list-max-ziplist-entries, list-max-ziplist-value, hash-max-ziplist-entries, hash-max-ziplist-value, set-max-intset-entries, zset-max-ziplist-entries, zset-max-ziplist-value etc.
EnableNonSslPort is used by Azure Redis Cache. The default value is null and no change will be made to the currently configured value. Possible values are true and false.
The number of shards to create on a Premium Cluster Cache.
You can pipe input to this cmdlet by property name, but not by value.
Returns all attributes of a redis cache including primary and secondary access keys.

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azurerm, arm, resource, management, manager, redis, cache, web, webapp, website

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Update Max Memory Policy
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\>New-AzureRmRedisCache -ResourceGroupName mygroup -Name mycache -RedisConfiguration @{"maxmemory-policy" = "allkeys-random"}
PrimaryKey : pJ+jruGKPHDKsEC8kmoybobH3TZx2njBR3ipEsquZFo= SecondaryKey : sJ+jruGKPHDKsEC8kmoybobH3TZx2njBR3ipEsquZFo= ResourceGroupName : mygroup Id : /subscriptions/a559b6fd-3a84-40bb-a450-b0db5ed37dfe/resourceGroups/mygroup/providers/Microsoft.Cache/Redis/mycache Location : North Central US Name : mycache Type : Microsoft.Cache/Redis HostName : mycache.cache.icbbvt.windows-int.net Port : 6379 ProvisioningState : creating SslPort : 6380 RedisConfiguration : {[maxmemory-policy, allkeys-random]} EnableNonSslPort : False RedisVersion : 2.8 Size : 250MB Sku : Standard

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command updates the updatable attributes of a redis cache.
